intro: Gomidesia miqueliana var. brunnea, commonly known as the brown-flowered gomidesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, often hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its flowers, which range in color from orange to red, are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. The varietal form brunnea is distinguished by its darker, more intensely colored flowers compared to the typical variety.
